channel.title: Re: Official Mopar Server
channel.description:
If you're about to flame for this being a MSCP related topic, then GTFO.
Okey-dokey, if you hadn't realized by now, this is a response to RXVL's topic on an official server. As some of you may know, I am currently developing a JavaBeans-style server, to "run faster and rape less resources" [quote gikid <3]. So I was thinking, maybe, just maybe, said in development server could be the "official" server.
Here are some pros and cons.
Pros: * More effecient and less resource rape, meaning not as much a load on mopar's dedi. * Less noobs asking HAO I CONECT TO SERVER LOLS PLZ I MAEK U ADMIN, since all they'll have to do is type in a username and password (considering the next version of MoparScape will automatically have [something like] server.moparisthebest.com filled in the Server IP section. * Event-, rather than time-driven * Easier to modify, all you'll need is to implement one interface to add a "module".
Cons: * Can't think of any :-]
So ya, anyone else agreeing on this?

item.title: Re: Official Mopar Server
item.dc:creator: @VB7_Rocks VB7 Rocks
item.description:
@VB7_Rocks wrote:

[quote=“1337h4x, post:81, topic:137080”][quote author=VB7 Rocks link=topic=188642.msg1733179#msg1733179 date=1188966340]

While you are all discussing what language to write it in, please note this server runs linux.

What CPU architecture does it use?

Don’t code for one CPU architecture either, good C++ code can be compiled on multiple platforms and architectures. This server uses x86, but it would probably run even better with x86_64

Heyyyy Moparisthebest, if Java uses ss.accept() (ss being an instance of ServerSocket) to accept clients (example), how does C++ interpret the packets it uses?
[/quote]The packets are the same…the only things that are different are the methods of opening sockets/sending packets/receiving packets in different languages. Btw that question makes no sense.[/quote]

Well, I’m asking if it would be as easy to connect (network) C++ to Java vs Java to Java, because I don’t think it would.

Read full topic

Btw that question makes no sense.
